name: decadency
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the process of becoming gradually damaged, worse, or less: Several business interests are in decadency and moving towards obsolescence. The decadency of empire is gradual, because it takes time to become great, and, after that, to decline.
disapproving low moral standards and behaviour: He believes that the main obstacles to success are corruption and decadency. We are in an age of rapidly accelerating decadency. Synonym
decadence
More examplesFewer examplesWherever you look you can see signs of decadency.One sign of decadency was the increase in crime.The media clearly portrays the increasing decadency of our civilization.
